languageTools.program.agent.rules

Class ListallDoRule

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • languageTools.program.agent.rules.Rule
        • languageTools.program.agent.rules.ListallDoRule
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>

    public class ListallDoRule
extends Rule

    A rule of the form:
        listall CONDITION -> VAR do RESULT.
    or:
        listall VAR <- CONDITION do RESULT.

    When evaluated, all possible substitutions that make the condition true are aggregated into a single Term, with which the given variable is instantiated. Only that variable will be bound in the ActionCombo that is the result of the rule (aside from possibly parameters of the parent module).
    The Term is created as a list of lists, where each 'sub-list' represents a single Substitution. Each value in the 'sub-list' is the value a variable in the condition would have if the corresponding Substitution was applied. The order of the variables is constant, and is the order of occurrence in the condition (in positive literals).

    Author:
    N.Kraayenbrink
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • ListallDoRule

        public ListallDoRule(MentalStateCondition condition,
             Var variable,
             ActionCombo action,
             InputStreamPosition source,
             boolean ltr)
        Creates a new ListallDoRule.
        Parameters:
        condition - The condition of the rule.
        variable - The variable to which the instances of the condition will be bound.
        action - The result of executing the new rule.
        source - From where in the stream the new ListallDoRule was read. May be null if not created by a parser.
        ltr - If the rule was defined with a ->. If false, the rule is assumed to be defined with a <-. Only affects the way the rule is printed in the Rule.toString()-methods.

        solutions - The set of solutions to process.
        language - The KR language.

        public Result apply(RunState<?> runState,
           java.util.Set<Substitution> substset,
           java.util.HashMap<Substitution,java.util.List<SingleGoal>> substGoalLinks,
           Substitution globalsubst)
        Description copied from class: Rule
        Applies the rule using the set of substitutions that validate the condition of the rule.
        Specified by:
        apply in class Rule
        Parameters:
        runState - the current run-state of the agent.
        substset - Set of substitutions that satisfy the condition of this rule.
        substGoalLinks - A set of links between Substitutions and lists of SingleGoals that validate the context of the target module with the given Substitution. Is something (not null) only if Rule.isRuleSinglegoal().
        globalsubst - the Substitution that holds at the rule's general level - the module level. This is the substi before we applied the condition. Needed in ListallDoRule.
        Returns:
        Result.

      • toRuleString

        public java.lang.String toRuleString()
        Description copied from class: Rule
        Version of toString that will automatically pick the correct version of #toIfThenString() or #toForallDoString(). This will usually be the same as Rule.toString(), except for a FocusRule. For a FocusRule this will return the same as #toIfThenString(), instead of a String-representation of the rule's target Module that is returned by Rule.toString().
        Specified by:
        toRuleString in class Rule
        Returns:
        A one-line String representation of this Rule. Should be the result of either #toIfThenString() or #toForallDoString().

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString(java.lang.String linePrefix)
        Description copied from class: Rule
        Generalization of Rule.toString(), allowing the returned string to be indented at various levels. Rules are printed including the trailing '.', and rules representing Modules are printed as a module.
        Specified by:
        toString in class Rule
        Parameters:
        linePrefix - What to prefix every line with
        Returns:
        A string-representation of this action rule, or the string-representation of the module this action rule represents.
